scenarioDescription:
The 75 Cet Exoplanetary System


Overview

75 Cet is a star with 2.49 times the mass of the Sun, and 10.5 times its radius. It is located 270.58 light years away from the solar system.

75 Cet is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the 75 Cet system


75 Cet b

75 Cet b was discovered by the Okayama Astrophysical Observatory observatory, in 2012-12, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of 75 Cet b is 954.000 times the mass of Earth. The radius of 75 Cet b is 13.100 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, 75 Cet b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system 75 Cet, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Okayama Astrophysical Observatory.
name: 75 Cet - System With 1 Exoplanet
